alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 10:05PM CDT until April 01 at 7:19AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, County Road 610 begins flooding near the Indian Creek bridge near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:31 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 10.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Maries River Westphalia 10.0 9.0 Wed 9 pm 4.8 3.6 3.1 2.7 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
